setData(java.io.InputStream).Description: Sets the input stream that provides the resource response's data. Callers must implement @B_java#io#InputStream#read_E@. @B_java#io#InputStream#close_E@ will be called after the WebView has finished with the response.

Parameters: int: the status code needs to be in the ranges [100, 299], [400, 599]. Causing a redirect by specifying a 3xx code is not supported.
String: the phrase describing the status code, for example "OK". Must be non-empty. This value must never be null.

InputStream: the input stream that provides the resource response's data. Must not be a StringBufferInputStream.
WebResourceResponse(java.lang.String,jav.Description: Constructs a resource response with the given MIME type, character encoding, and input stream. Callers must implement @B_java#io#InputStream#read_E@ for the input stream. @B_java#io#InputStream#close_E@ will be called after the WebView has finished with the response. "text/html" and "utf-8"), not a single value like the "text/html; charset=utf-8" format used in the HTTP Content-Type header. Do not use the value of a HTTP Content-Encoding header for encoding, as that header does not specify a character encoding. Content without a defined character encoding (for example image resources) should pass null for encoding.

ClassDesc: Encapsulates a resource response. Applications can return an instance of this class from @B_android#webkit#WebViewClient#shouldInterceptRequest_E@ to provide a custom response when the WebView requests a particular resource.
